Definition at line 378 of file GrShader.cpp.

bool GrShader::BindUserSampler ( const char *  name,
unsigned int  texUnit 
)

binds a shader sampler to the sampler passed in. The sampler will perform all texture fetches from that sampler. Valid values are [0..15]. This function will return false if no valid samplers are available.

check to see if we're reassigning a sampler.

are we reassigning a sampler?

performance warning: this is not a cheap thing to do. This should only be done when a sampler changes!

if we're not reassigning a sampler, check for a free one.

store the user sampler information.

make sure that a user sampler slot was available. If not, we should return false to indicate this case to the caller.

success!

bool GrShader::IsGLSamplerUsed ( unsigned int  texUnit  ) 

returns true or false if a sampler is used by the shader.

check all user samplers for the GL sampler passed in.

check all quality levels for the given sampler.

return false if the sampler isn't used by any quality levels.

bool GrShader::Rebuild ( const tstring &  vSource,
const tstring &  fSource 
)

public methods

rebuilds the shader. Returns true if the source compiled successfully. On failure, the error shader is used.

set the source and build the shader.

check to see if any errors occured.

return false to indicate an error if necessary.

return true to indicate success.

renderer driven params.

ensure the GL is okay.

if the param doesn't exist, simply return.

the program must be bound before any of it's parameters can be updated!

update the parameter's value.

if there is an error here, check to ensure you're calling the right function! the parameter's type must match the function called!
